BR_text.BRsummary: [Doc] Inconsistent of param signature between AutoIAFNormal and affine_autoregressive
BR_text.BRdescription:
Doc for AutoIAFNormal (<denchmark-link:http://docs.pyro.ai/en/stable/infer.autoguide.html#autoiafnormal>http://docs.pyro.ai/en/stable/infer.autoguide.html#autoiafnormal</denchmark-link>
 ) says hidden_dims is an int
 While <denchmark-link:http://docs.pyro.ai/en/stable/distributions.html?highlight=affine_autoregressive#affine-autoregressive>http://docs.pyro.ai/en/stable/distributions.html?highlight=affine_autoregressive#affine-autoregressive</denchmark-link>
  claims that hidden_dims should be a list of int.
 Is that a typo in AutoIAFNormal's doc?

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xidulu>@xidulu</denchmark-link>
  thanks for picking this up! Yes, I believe this is a bug in the docstring for . It should be . If you passed in an  for  to  it would raise an exception when it gets to this code in :
 <denchmark-code>        # Hidden dimension must be not less than the input otherwise it isn't
         # possible to connect to the outputs correctly
         for h in hidden_dims:
             if h < input_dim:
                 raise ValueError('Hidden dimension must not be less than input dimension.')
 </denchmark-code>
 
 It's not being caught by the unit tests since they use the default argument of hidden_dims=None.

comments_2.comment_text: Are you able to submit a PR for this quick change?

comments_3.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/martinjankowiak>@martinjankowiak</denchmark-link>
  you designed the unit tests for autoguides, right? Do you think it would be worth adjusting the unit tests slightly to test non-default keyword args?

comments_4.comment_text: it seems like all our autoguide unit tests are integration tests; we could probably use some simple smoke tests like we have for <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/blob/f3494ac9e2428b36d6840e4d3a6dbd31daaf4d30/tests/contrib/easyguide/test_easyguide.py#L102>easyguide</denchmark-link>

comments_5.comment_text:
Are you able to submit a PR for this quick change?
 
 Sure，I can do that
